definition: social status/price of a slave/price of a person (a sportsman etc)/worth/value (of stocks, valuables etc)
body/life/oneself/personally/one's morality and conduct/the main part of a structure or body/pregnant/classifier for sets of clothes: suit, twinset/Kangxi radical 158

sentences.english: After her acting career, Chen became a billionaire in the advertising business.
sentences.chinese: 结束演艺生涯后，陈晓旭从事广告业，身价过亿。

sentences.english: As oil prices skyrocketed, Gaddafi and his family suddenly had more money than they knew what to do with.
sentences.chinese: 得利于油价的飙升，卡扎菲家族身价倍增。

sentences.english: Once again he was the most expensive player in the world.
sentences.chinese: 他又一次成为世界上身价最高的球员。

sentences.english: This is the opulence of the twin suites layout… a temple of your supreme status.
sentences.chinese: 豪华双套房设计，彰显豪迈气派，倍添矜贵身价。

sentences.english: The stakes for high-net-worth dogs continue to rise.
sentences.chinese: 高净值”名犬的身价越来越高了。

sentences.english: Mr. Wang likes to mention a heavy hitter as his friend to promote his status.
sentences.chinese: 王先生为了提高身价，喜欢提起大人物的朋友。

sentences.english: The " Yao factor" is already driving up prices for sponsorships and naming rights.
sentences.chinese: “姚明现象”已经令赞助费和冠名权身价大增。

sentences.english: I do not want to raise any place in their own worth, and do not highlight.
sentences.chinese: 我不愿在任何地方抬高自己的身价，也不要突出。

sentences.english: Tommaso Rocchi insists his value has "tripled" in recent seasons at Lazio.
sentences.chinese: 罗基坚持他的身价在本赛季之后翻了三倍。

sentences.english: A mountain rivers for their discontent worth beefing up, give him Too Big for Her Skin.
sentences.chinese: 百川不满一山为自己催谷身价，大骂他不自量力。

sentences.english: I'm not going to dignify his comments by reacting to them.
sentences.chinese: 我才不会理睬他的评论以抬高他的身价。

sentences.english: Fakers lose their class and play dirty.
sentences.chinese: 骗子队丢了身价打球龌龊。

sentences.english: The recession is doing funny things with the price of time.
sentences.chinese: 衰退令时间的身价出现了有趣的变化。

sentences.english: Each and every dog breed has its own pricing and therefore differs from one another.
sentences.chinese: 每种而且每条狗都有他们自己的身价从而与众不同。

sentences.english: The university also faces threatened legal action from a group of its highest-paid executives.
sentences.chinese: 大学也面临着来自一群高身价行政人员的法律威胁。

sentences.english: Many bemoan what they see as the cheapening of the area.
sentences.chinese: 许多人都在抱怨，说这片区域在不断自降身价。

definition: (used for transliteration)/old variant of 謳|讴[ou1]
Europe/abbr. for 歐洲|欧洲[Ou1 zhou1]/surname Ou
asking price/to ask a price/to demand terms (in negotiations)
to transfer to another club (professional sports)
the tide rises, the boat floats (idiom); fig. to change with the overall trend/to develop according to the situation
currently popular (of movie stars, singers etc)
